item.title: Melinda add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The ornament of a house is the friends who frequent it." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Kahil Gibran
item.description: "Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need." -- Kahil Gibran

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "You cannot simultaneously prevent and prepare for war." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Melinda add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Mick Jagger
item.description: "You can't always get what you want, but if you try sometimes, you might find, you get what you need." -- Mick Jagger

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Dali Lama
item.description: "World peace must develop from inner peace. Peace is not just mere absence of violence. Peace is, I think, the manifestation of human compassion." -- Dali Lama

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection" -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Ernesto Che Guevara
item.description: "There are no boundaries in this struggle to the death. We cannot be indifferent to what happens anywhere in the world, for a victory by any country over imperialism is our victory; just as any country's defeat is a defeat for all of us." -- Ernesto Che Guevara

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Melinda add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Melinda add a quote by Theodore Roethke
item.description: "The darkness has it's own light." -- Theodore Roethke
